definition: lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold, money cannot buy you time. (idiom)/fig. Time is precious and must be treasured.
pinyin: yi1 cun4 guang1 yin1 yi1 cun4 jin1 , cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1
traditional: 一寸光陰一寸金，寸金難買寸光陰
word: 一寸光阴一寸金，寸金难买寸光阴

overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia

lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold. (idiom)/fig. free time is to be treasured

definition: An ounce of gold can't buy you an interval of time (idiom); Money can't buy you time./Time is precious.
pinyin: cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1

definition: if you are lazy in your prime, you'll be sorry in your old age
pinyin: shao4 zhuang4 bu4 nu3 li4 , lao3 da4 tu2 shang1 bei1
related.word: 少壮不努力，老大徒伤悲

definition: a very brief period of time (lit. the time it takes for a shadow to move an inch)
one cannot achieve glory and wealth without having been through trials and tribulations (proverb)/no pain, no gain
pinyin: chi1 de2 ku3 zhong1 ku3 , fang1 wei2 ren2 shang4 ren2
related.word: 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人

definition: sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
To learn without thinking is confusing, to think without learning is dangerous (Confucius)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 si1 ze2 wang3 , si1 er2 bu4 xue2 ze2 dai4
related.word: 学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆

definition: If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
related.word: 只要功夫深，铁杵磨成针

definition: He who gives no thought to far-flung problems soon finds suffering nearby (idiom, from Analects)./Smug concentration on the here and now will lead to future sorrow.
pinyin: ren2 wu2 yuan3 lu:4 , bi4 you3 jin4 you1

definition: being bright at an early age does not necessarily bring success upon growing up (proverb)
pinyin: xiao3 shi2 liao3 liao3 , da4 wei4 bi4 jia1
